      • addPerson

        protected void addPerson(P p)
                  throws InvalidFieldException
        Adds a person, resorts the table. Updates the stored game data.
        Parameters:
        c -
        Throws:
        InvalidFieldException - Thrown if ID already in use.

      • removePerson

        public void removePerson(P p)
        Removes a person from the table and GameData.
        Parameters:
        p - Person to remove.

      • updatePerson

        public void updatePerson(P p)
                  throws InvalidFieldException
        Updates the stored person with the same ID to hold the currently stored information. Overwrites everything in the current position, also will resort the data table.
        If the ID is not present, it WILL create a new entry.
        Parameters:
        c - New contestant data.
        Throws:
        InvalidFieldException - Thrown if attempting to add a contestant which has an ID already present

      • setRowSelect

        public void setRowSelect(int row,
                boolean viewIndex)
        Helper method that forces only ONE row select per event call. Thus, if multiple sources ask it to change rows, it maintains the old, but will invalidate them, thus not allowing them to run. This breaks nothing as all those calls do is use up time and memory.
        Parameters:
        row - Row to select
        viewIndex - TODO
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - On row < -1.

      • setRowSelect

        public void setRowSelect(P p)
        Helper method for PersonTableModel.setRowSelect(int) for passing a Person in.
        Parameters:
        p -
